page.title: 16FARMING NEAR INVERURIE
page.content:
The crops that are grown on the farms in the area include barley, oats, turnips, potatoes, hay and silage. A recent crop introduced to the area is oilseed rape which is grown for its oil and animal feed. After harvesting the crops are sent to merchants, but some are kept for winter feed.
The cattle include Aberdeen Angus and Hereford which are reared for beef. The dairy cattle include Ayrshire and Friesian. In winter the animals are fed on barley, oats, hay and silage. As the winters can be quite cold and severe most of the animals are housed indoors during the winter months.
The nearest market is in Aberdeen. The Mart (market) in Inverurie was closed a short time ago.
